abstract: Poll conducted by The New York Times, Resources for the Future and Stanford University finds that overwhelming majority of Americans believe government should address global warming; reveals that two-thirds of Americans are more likely to vote for political candidates who support fighting climate change, and that around half of Republicans agree with this sentiment, although similar number also believe that addressing global warming will hurt economy.
lead_paragraph: A poll found that about half of Republicans would favor a presidential candidate who supports fighting climate change.

byline.contributor: Coral Davenport reported from Washington, and Marjorie Connelly from New York. Marina Stefan contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and MARJORIE CONNELLY

snippet: A poll found that about half of Republicans would favor a presidential candidate who supports fighting climate change.

headline.main: Most Republicans Say They Back Climate Action, Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Half in G.O.P. Say They Back Climate Action
